name: pyrinoline
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1432
Reason: Pyrinoline is a heterocyclic compound that contains a piperidine ring and a pyrrole ring. The basic unit for this compound is the pyrrole ring, which has a melting point of approximately 150°C. The presence of the piperidine ring increases the melting point due to the additional intermolecular hydrogen bonding and pi-pi stacking interactions. The overall effect is an increase of approximately +20°C.
